doc.after: Austrian philosopher of science Paul Feyerabend argued that no description of scientific method could possibly be broad enough to encompass all the approaches and methods used by scientists He claimed there are no useful and exception free methodological rules governing the progress of science Feyerabend objected to prescriptive scientific method on the grounds that any such method would stifle and cramp scientific progress Feyerabend claimed the only principle that does not inhibit progress is anything goes 40
